typography.headingStyle: Large bold serif (appears to be Georgia or similar), high contrast black on white

components.notable: Minimal, stark presentation typical of server error pages

design.visualHierarchy: Single dominant element with vast whitespace, drawing focus to the error message

flow.userIntent: User has navigated to a non-existent page and needs to understand what happened and how to recover
entryPoints: Direct URL navigation to invalid path
exitPoints: Search or menu navigation (if available in full app)
flow.informationArchitecture: Minimal error state with no recovery guidance visible
frictionPoints: No visible CTA or navigation options
No explanation of why page doesn't exist
No way forward without manual action

typography.headingStyle: Large sans-serif, all-caps for logo, sentence case for headlines
typography.bodyStyle: Medium weight sans-serif, light gray on dark background

components.description: Top bar with logo, nav menu, and social icons
components.notable: Electrum branding with atomic nucleus icon, horizontal nav menu right-aligned

components.description: Left-aligned text with heading and descriptive copy
Six feature tiles with icons and descriptions
components.notable: 3x2 grid layout with Safe, Forgiving, Instant On, No Lock-In, No Downtimes, Proof Checking

design.visualHierarchy: Eye drawn to hero section left, secondary focus on network visualization right, tertiary to feature tiles below
innovativeElements: Network diagram visualization for decentralization concept
Blue neon glow aesthetic on branding
Warning banner integrated into design hierarchy

flow.userIntent: Understand what Electrum is and its key benefits before downloading
entryPoints: External links from documentation or community

interactiveElements.element: Navigation menu (Home, Download, Documentation, Community, About)

interactiveElements.action: Likely scroll-triggered animations or hover states

flow.informationArchitecture: Top-down: brand identity → value proposition → key features → call to action (download implied below)
frictionPoints: Security warning placed prominently but could deter new users
No visible download button in this viewport
Feature benefits presented without interactive exploration

copy.headline: Improve your Bitcoin Experience
copy.subheadline: Securing Bitcoin payments since 2011, Electrum is one of the most popular Bitcoin wallets.

microcopy.text: Warning: Do not download Electrum from a source other than electrum.org. Verify GPG signatures.
microcopy.purpose: Security trust signal and fraud prevention

microcopy.text: Electrum is fast, secure and easy to use. It suits the needs of a wide spectrum of users.
Your private keys are encrypted and never leave your computer.

trustSignals: One of the most popular Bitcoin wallets

typography.headingStyle: Bold serif headings (Name, Last modified, Size, Description columns)
typography.bodyStyle: Monospace for version numbers, regular serif for dates

components.description: Sortable columns with folder icons and version links
components.notable: Standard directory listing with hyperlinked versions (1.8.1, 1.8, 1.9.1, etc.)

design.visualHierarchy: Uniform grid structure with column headers guiding scan

flow.userIntent: Find and download specific historical versions of Electrum
exitPoints: Click on version folder to see release files

interactiveElements.element: Column headers (Name, Last modified, Size, Description)
interactiveElements.action: Likely sortable in full directory listing UI

flow.informationArchitecture: Hierarchical directory structure with version folders listed chronologically
frictionPoints: Minimal visual design may feel outdated
No filtering or search mechanism visible
No descriptions of what changed in each version
All versions listed equally with no indication of stability or recommendation

copy.headline: Index of /
trustSignals: Historical version availability dating back to 2011 implied by version numbers

typography.headingStyle: Bold sans-serif for main content heading, medium weight for sidebar sections
typography.bodyStyle: Regular serif for body paragraphs, sans-serif for UI labels

components.description: Left sidebar with hierarchical documentation menu
components.notable: Dark background with color-coded section headers (blue for ADVANCED USERS, DAEMON AND COMMAND LINE, FOR DEVELOPERS)

components.description: Home icon and 'Simple Payment Verification' link
components.notable: Shows current page location in hierarchy

components.description: Main documentation content with heading and paragraphs
components.notable: Serif font body text with embedded blue hyperlinks

components.description: Previous and Next buttons with icon indicators
components.notable: Ghost button style with clear directional indicators

components.description: Copyright, build tool credits, and banner ad
components.notable: Links to Sphinx, theme providers, and ethical ads

design.visualHierarchy: Sidebar provides persistent context, main content dominates visual space, navigation controls at bottom guide next steps

flow.userIntent: Learn technical details about Simple Payment Verification

interactiveElements.element: Sidebar navigation items (categorized by ADVANCED USERS, DAEMON AND COMMAND LINE, FOR DEVELOPERS)
Inline hyperlinks (Bitcoin: A peer-to-peer Electronic Cash System)

flow.informationArchitecture: Hierarchical documentation with main navigation sidebar and sequential pagination through topics
frictionPoints: Left sidebar navigation requires scrolling to see all options
Dense technical paragraphs without visual breaks
Current page highlighted in sidebar but not immediately obvious to all users
progressIndicators: Previous/Next buttons indicating position in sequential flow

copy.headline: Simple Payment Verification

microcopy.text: Built with Sphinx using a theme provided by Read the Docs. Dark theme provided by MrDogeBro.

trustSignals: Copyright attribution to Thomas Voegtlin (Electrum creator)
